purpose: To enable the development and training of embodied AI agents that can perform tasks in simulated environments, facilitating research in AI navigation and interaction.
principle: Built on top of PyTorch, it leverages deep reinforcement learning and simulation environments to train agents for various tasks.
reusability: Highly modular with API support for integrating custom environments and tasks; compatible with Habitat-Sim for simulation.
limitations: Primarily focused on simulated environments, with limited real-world application without sim-to-real transfer techniques.
name: habitat-lab
description: A modular high-level library to train embodied AI agents across a variety of tasks and environments.
highlight: Provides a modular framework for training embodied AI agents in simulated environments, focusing on navigation and interaction tasks.
